recipes.title: Tomato Salad
recipes.ingredients:
4 ripe tomatoes (180g/ 6oz each) (Note 1)
1 1/2 tsp finely minced eschalots (US: shallots) (Note 2)
1/2 tsp finely minced garlic (use a knife, not garlic press)
1 tbsp white wine vinegar (Note 3)
3 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
3/4 tsp cooking / kosher salt
2 pinches white pepper
1 1/2 tbsp finely sliced basil leaves
recipes.instructions:
Cut the tomatoes into 8 or 10 wedges, cutting out the core. Place in a large bowl.
    Sprinkle over eschallots, garlic, salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil and vinegar.
    Gently toss to coat tomatoes. Add basil, toss again to disperse.
    Pour into bowl and serve immediately! (Tip: Bread for mopping up the tomato juices is on point).

recipes.title: Vegan Harissa Pasta
recipes.ingredients:
250 g dry linguine noodles
    2 tsp (10 mL) olive oil
    1 medium onion, chopped
    3 cloves garlic, minced
    2 roasted red bell peppers from a jar, chopped
    2 cups (60 g) fresh spinach, chopped
    1½ Tbsp (25 g) tomato paste
    1 vegetable bouillon cube, crushed
    2 Tbsp (30 mL) harissa sauce†
    1 Tbsp (3 g) dried oregano
    ½ tsp paprika powder
    ¼ tsp salt, plus more to taste
    1 cup (240 mL) soy cooking cream
    1 cup (134 g) frozen green peas
    3 Tbsp (7 g) nutritional yeast flakes
    3 Tbsp (25 g) roasted pine nuts
    ½ lemon, zested, juiced
recipes.instructions:
Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, draining it 1 minute before it's al dente. Just before draining, reserve ½ cup (120 mL) of the pasta cooking water.
    To a sauté pan on high heat, add the olive oil. While the oil heats up, chop the onion and add it to the pan to cook for 4 - 5 minutes. Meanwhile, continue with the next step.
    Mince the garlic, and chop the roasted red bell peppers and spinach.
    Add the garlic to the pot to cook for 2 minutes, stirring often. When lightly golden, add in the tomato paste, bouillon cube, harissa, oregano, paprika powder, and salt, and cook this for another 2 minutes.
    Add the reserved pasta cooking water to the pan, then drain the pasta.
    Add the drained pasta to the pan as well, along with all the remaining ingredients: the cooking cream, peas, nutritional yeast, pine nuts, bell pepper, and spinach.
    Once heated through, add some lemon zest (optional) and squeeze over the lemon juice. Garnish and enjoy!
recipes.notes: Harissa offers a deep tangy and spicy flavour, so add less if you'd prefer less heat.

recipes.title: Spicy Garlic Wok Noodles
recipes.ingredients:
Seasoned tofu
2 Tbsp(30 mL) azeite
650 g tofu (cortado em cubos) 
2 Tbsp (30 ml) ketjap manis

Stir fry
1 Tbsp (15 ml) óleo de sésamo
6 chalotas médias picadas
10 dentes de alho picado 
2 bróculos 
370 g ramen noodles
2 pimentão vermelho picado
2 cups (298 g) tomate-cereja
4 Tbsp (60 ml) molho de soja dark
4 Tbsp (60 mL) sambal oelek,
recipes.instructions:
Numa panela grande em lume alto, adicione o azeite. Quando estiver quente, adicione o tofu. Mexa a cada poucos minutos, com cuidado para  o tofu não se desfazer. Quando estiver levemente dourado em todos os lados, adicione o ketjap, misture bem e retire do lume.
Numa frigideira ou wok em lume médio-alto, adicione o óleo de sésamo, as chalotas, o alho e os bróculos e cozinhe por 6 minutos.
 Cozinhe a massa de acordo com as instruções da embalagem. O ideal é escorrer quando o macarrão estiver a 2 minutos de ficar al dente*. Passe o macarrão em água fria.
 Adicione o macarrão escorrido à panela com o brócolis. Adicione também o tofu, pimentão, tomate, molho de soja e sambal. Misture bem e aqueça até que o macarrão esteja totalmente cozido.
Decore com sementes de sésamo e sirva!
recipes.notes:
Sirva com cebolinho a gosto

recipes.title: Bolonhesa de Soja
recipes.instructions:
Cozinhar a soja seguindo as instruções do pacote
 Faça um refogado com a cebola e os dentes de alho até ficarem translucidos.
 Adicione a soja, a polpa de tomate, os pimentos e os temperos. Deixe cozinhar mais alguns minutos.
Retificar os temperos e já está.
recipes.notes: Sirva com massa (penne, esparguete ou outra que desejar)
